org.eng.aisp.classifier.anomaly

Class MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.classifier.anomaly.MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IAnomalyDetector<double[]>

    public class MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector
extends Object
implements IAnomalyDetector<double[]>
    Checks for a minimum percentage of anomalies within an array of doubles to determine if an anomaly is present. Each element of the data array is assigned its own IAnomalyDetector according to the constructor. Alls calls to update(boolean, boolean, long, double[]) and isAnomaly(long, double[]) must provide a data array the same length and of a length defined by the array of IAnomalyDetector instances provided to the constructor.
    Author:
    DavidWood
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • detectors

        protected final IAnomalyDetector<Double>[] detectors

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector

        public MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector(IAnomalyDetector<Double>[] detectors,
                                       int minVotes)
        Defines the instance to act on array of doubles and only declare an anomaly when the given number of anomalies is found within the double array provided to isAnomaly(long, double[]).
        Parameters:
        detectors - defines the length of the array of doubles provided to isAnomaly(long, double[]) and update(boolean, boolean, long, double[]) in 1:1 correspondence with the double arrays provided to those calls.
        minVotes - the minimum number of anomalies declared within an array before an anomaly is declared on a given array. Must be larger than 0 and less then or equal to the number of detectors given here.

      • MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector

        public MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector(IAnomalyDetectorBuilder<Double> detectorBuilder,
                                       int dataLen,
                                       int minVotes)
        A convenience on MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector(IAnomalyDetector[], int) to create the detectors with the given builder.
        Parameters:
        detectorBuilder - instance to create the IAnomalyDetector instances for each data array element.
        dataLen - the expect length of the arrays passed to isAnomaly(long, double[]) and update(boolean, boolean, long, double[]).
        minVotes -

    • Method Detail

      • isAnomaly

        public IAnomalyDetector.AnomalyResult isAnomaly(long atTime,
                                                double[] data)
                                         throws AISPException
        Description copied from interface: IAnomalyDetector
        Determines if the given data at the given time is anomalous.
        Specified by:
        isAnomaly in interface IAnomalyDetector<double[]>
        Parameters:
        atTime - the time with which the data is associated. Some implementations may choose to ignore this, but it can generally be assumed that the given time is later than any times provided to update().
        data - the data to be checked for anomalous status
        Returns:
        an indication of whether the piece of data is anomalous and confidence values.
        Throws:
        AISPException

      • update

        public void update(boolean isOfflineTraining,
                   boolean isNormal,
                   long atTime,
                   double[] data)
            throws AISPException
        Description copied from interface: IAnomalyDetector
        Make new data readings available to the detector. This is generally called during initial training of the detector and may be call during operation when IAnomalyDetector.isAnomaly(long, Object) is being called.
        Specified by:
        update in interface IAnomalyDetector<double[]>
        Parameters:
        isOfflineTraining - true if called prior to making any calls to IAnomalyDetector.isAnomaly(long, Object).
        isNormal - true if the given sample is known to be normal, otherwise the given sample is abnormal/anomalous.
        atTime - the time associated with the given data. This is generally increasing and any value should be larger than the value provided to any previous calls to this instance. Note that when isOfflineTraining is false, IAnomalyDetector.isAnomaly(long, Object) may have been called prior to call this method with the same value of this parameter.
        data - the data to incorporate into the model as either normal or abnormal/anomalous.
        Throws:
        AISPException

      • beginNewDeployment

        public void beginNewDeployment()
        Description copied from interface: IAnomalyDetector
        Signal the anomaly detector that it is being deployed in a new environment so that it may try and adapt to this new environment. This should restore the instance to the state prior to have been updated with online data through the IAnomalyDetector.update(boolean, boolean, long, Object) call.
        Specified by:
        beginNewDeployment in interface IAnomalyDetector<double[]>
